page.title: 20THE TOWN OF BOURNEMOUTH
page.content: BOURNEMOUTH IS SITUATED ON THE SOUTH COAST OF ENGLAND BETWEEN THE ANCIENT TOWNS OF POOLE AND CHRISTCHURCH. THE TOWN IS FAMOUS AS A HOLIDAY RESORT, PERHAPS BECAUSE OF THE SUN, SAND AND SEA. IT IS ALSO A USEFUL TOURING CENTRE FOR THE LOCAL ATTRACTIVE COUNTRYSIDE INCLUDING THE NEW FOREST. RECENTLY THE LOCAL AUTHORITY HAS TRIED TO TURN BOURNEMOUTH INTO A CONFERENCE CENTRE BY BUILDING THE B.I.C. (BOURNEMOUTH INTERNATIONAL CENTRE). BOURNEMOUTH IS ALSO VERY POPULAR AS A RETIREMENT AREA AND THERE ARE MANY SENIOR CITIZENS IN THE TOWN. BECAUSE OF THE TOURIST TRADE AND THE AGE OF MANY OF BOURNEMOUTH'S RESIDENTS JOBS IN THE TOWN TEND TO BE IN HOTELS, SHOPS AND OFFICES RATHER THAN IN FACTORIES, MILLS OR DOCKS.
